episodeTitle: A Battle in the Heat! Luffy vs. The Giant Dragon!
description: The Straw Hats encounter a massive fire-breathing dragon on Punk Hazard. Luffy and Zoro battle the creature, discovering mysterious human legs attached to it. Meanwhile, the crew members on the Thousand Sunny are gassed and captured by mysterious figures in hazmat suits.

events.title: Battle Against Dragon Number Thirteen Begins
events.description: Luffy, Zoro, Robin, and Usopp encounter Dragon Number Thirteen, a massive artificial dragon created by Vegapunk. The dragon demonstrates the ability to speak and breathe fire, surprising the Straw Hats.
events.significance: First major battle on Punk Hazard, introducing the mystery of Vegapunk's creations and setting up the arc's central conflicts.

quotes.text: A talking dragon?! That's so cool!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's excitement upon discovering the dragon can speak

events.title: Luffy Uses Gomu Gomu no Jet Pistol
events.description: Luffy attacks the dragon with Gomu Gomu no Jet Pistol, one of his Gear Second techniques. However, the attack doesn't significantly damage the dragon due to its incredibly hard scales.
events.significance: Demonstrates that the dragon is extremely durable, requiring more powerful techniques to defeat.

events.title: Dragon Number Thirteen's Fire Breath
events.description: The dragon unleashes massive streams of fire breath attacks at the Straw Hats. The group narrowly evades the powerful flames, with Usopp trembling in fear while Luffy and Zoro get excited about the challenge.
events.significance: Reveals the full combat capabilities of Vegapunk's artificial dragon creation.

events.title: Zoro's Santoryu Ul-Tora Gari (Ultra Hunt)
events.description: Zoro charges at the dragon and uses Santoryu Ul-Tora Gari (Three Sword Style: Ultra Hunt), a powerful technique that shakes the dragon. However, the dragon proves resilient and recovers quickly.
events.significance: Showcases Zoro's post-timeskip sword techniques against a powerful opponent.

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro unleashing his Three Sword Style technique against the dragon

events.title: Dragon Mentions the Shichibukai
events.description: During the battle, the dragon asks if the Straw Hats are allies of 'that Shichibukai,' causing Robin to question if it has a grudge. This mysterious reference hints at the island's connection to one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea.
events.significance: First hint at the connection between Punk Hazard and a Shichibukai, foreshadowing the reveal of Trafalgar Law's involvement.

quotes.text: Are you allies of that Shichibukai?
quotes.speaker: Dragon Number Thirteen
quotes.context: The dragon questioning the Straw Hats about their allegiance

events.title: Discovery of Kin'emon's Legs
events.description: Luffy stumbles and rolls around on the dragon's body, discovering a pair of human legs sticking out of the dragon's head. These legs belong to Kin'emon, a samurai from Wano whose body was dismembered and scattered by Trafalgar Law.
events.significance: Introduction of Kin'emon (partially) to the story, beginning the mystery of the samurai that will become a major ally. The legs can speak through farts, creating both comedy and intrigue.

quotes.text: Hey! There are legs sticking out of this dragon!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's discovery of the mysterious legs attached to the dragon

events.title: Luffy Forces Dragon to Bite Its Wing
events.description: Luffy makes the dragon accidentally bite its own wing by thrusting it forward into the dragon's mouth. The dragon yelps in pain and begins to fall from the sky, creating an opening for Zoro.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's creative combat tactics and sets up the finishing blow.

events.title: Zoro Decapitates Dragon Number Thirteen
events.description: Zoro charges forward and yells at Usopp, who uses his Trampolia to launch Zoro into the air. Zoro then uses his signature technique Ittoryu Iai: Shi Shishi Sonson (One Sword Style Iai: Lion's Song of Death) to cleanly decapitate Dragon Number Thirteen, ending the battle.
events.significance: Showcases the teamwork between the Straw Hats and Zoro's enhanced strength post-timeskip. The dragon's death provides food for the crew and allows them to retrieve Kin'emon's legs.

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro's finishing attack that decapitates the dragon

events.title: Luffy Names the Legs 'Ashimaro'
events.description: After pulling off Kin'emon's talking legs from the dragon, Luffy, being Luffy, decides to keep the mysterious talking legs and even gives them a name: 'Ashimaro.'
events.significance: Classic Luffy moment that adds comedy while setting up the eventual reunion with Kin'emon's body parts.

events.title: Sleeping Gas Attack on Thousand Sunny
events.description: Back at the Thousand Sunny, Sanji finishes making a meal for Nami and calls for her, but finds everybody (Nami, Chopper, Franky, and Brook) is asleep with fog floating around. Sanji realizes it's not fog but actually sleeping gas.
events.significance: Beginning of the kidnapping subplot that separates the crew and introduces the mysterious forces at work on Punk Hazard.

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji realizing the danger before succumbing to the sleeping gas

events.title: Hazmat Suit Figures Capture Straw Hats
events.description: A group of peculiar individuals emerge in hazmat suits with the letters 'PH' on them. They capture Sanji, Nami, Franky, and Chopper, except for Brook, whom they believe is already dead. The captives are taken to be delivered to their 'master.'
events.significance: Introduction of Caesar Clown's subordinates and the setup for the crew's separation. This event drives the next phase of the Punk Hazard arc.

themes.description: The episode showcases how the Straw Hats work together in combat, with Usopp providing support for Zoro's finishing attack and Luffy creating openings for his crewmates.
themes.symbolism: The coordinated attack on the dragon represents the crew's growth and ability to work as a unified fighting force after their two-year separation.

themes.description: The episode is filled with mysteries: the talking dragon, the legs attached to it, the mention of a Shichibukai, and the mysterious kidnappers in hazmat suits.
themes.symbolism: Punk Hazard represents the unknown dangers of the New World, where even inanimate objects and environments hold secrets and threats.

themes.description: The crew becomes separated as half are kidnapped while the other half battles the dragon, creating tension and parallel storylines.
themes.symbolism: The separation of the crew reflects the increased dangers of the New World where even staying together requires constant vigilance.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended some of the combat sequences between the Straw Hats and the dragon with additional animation.
The sleeping gas scene on the Thousand Sunny was expanded with additional reactions and dialogue from the crew members.

trivia.fact: Dragon Number Thirteen was Vegapunk's first successful attempt at creating an artificial dragon, with twelve failed attempts before it.

sources.title: Dragon Number Thirteen - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first partial appearance of Kin'emon, who would become a major ally to the Straw Hats throughout the Wano Country arc.
The dragon measured 70 meters (229 feet) in length, making it one of the largest creatures the Straw Hats had faced up to this point.

sources.title: Dragon Number Thirteen - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Episode 580 is part of Season 16 and the Punk Hazard Arc, which spans episodes 579-625 (excluding episode 590, which was a crossover special).
The 'PH' on the hazmat suits stands for Punk Hazard, the island where these events take place.
Zoro's technique 'Ittoryu Iai: Shi Shishi Sonson' is an upgraded version of his original 'Shishi Sonson' technique, developed during his two-year training with Mihawk.
